introduction: The Fluid mechanics is a branch of the science which deals with the behavior of the fluids (Pressure, Velocity, force etc.) when fluid is in rest or in motion. The fluids are categorised in two broad categories liquids and gases. The fluid mechanics is a study of static, kinematics and dynamic behavior of the fluid. In Fluid kinematics the force(pressure) is not considered while in dynamics the force is also considered. The effect of temperature on behavior of fluid is not taken into consideration

experiments.name: Centre of Buoyancy of Rectangular Block
Centre of Buoyancy of Circular Log
To Find the Density of Stone
Metacentre and Stability of Wooden Block
Metacentre and Stability of Circular Block
Lift and Drag on Sphere and Cylinder

objective:
• To create a simulated platform to mimic the physical lab of Fluid Mechanics
  • To enable formative assessment.
    • To include pitfalls to make the user connect the fundamentals of Fluid Mechanics to the given lab.
  • To try take the traditional physical lab to higher cognitive levels

courseAlignment.description: The syllabi of this lab aligns to the following universities in India.
universities: Nirma University; Fluid Flow Operation (2CH302); B. Tech
Dharamsinh Desai University; Fluid Flow Operations (CH-501); B. Tech
The M S University of Baroda; Fluid Flow Operation (CHL 1401); B. Tech
